flawed_nl_solution:
In the large orders, Lisa used 3 large orders * 200g of packing peanuts per large order = <<3*200=600>>600g of packing peanuts.
The rest of the packing peanuts were used in small orders so there was a total of 800g packing peanuts - 600g of packing peanuts used in large orders = <<800-600=2000>>2000g of packing peanuts used in small orders.
So there must have been 2000g of packing peanuts / 50g of packing peanuts per small order = <<2000/50=40>>40 small orders.
#### 40

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 200, not 2000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
